snippet: The episode revived accusations that the United States and its allies are not careful enough about who is killed by airstrikes on militant groups.
abstract: Resident in village of Atmeh in Syria say American-led military coalition's airstrike killed eight civilians, including five children and two women; strike targeted munitions factory run by Islamist rebel group, but residents say explosions caused roofs in nearby homes to cave in.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and KARAM SHOUMALI
byline.contributor: Maher Samaan contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The episode revived accusations that the United States and its allies are not careful enough about who is killed by airstrikes on militant groups.

headline.main: U.S.-Led Air Campaign Is Linked to Civilian Deaths in Syria
headline.print_headline: U.S.-Led Strike in Syria Is Tied to Civilian Deaths

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
